alert.note: Alert for Bourbon (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 02 at 8:12PM EST until January 03 at 6:00AM EST by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Kentucky... Stoner Creek at Paris affecting Bourbon County. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Stoner Creek at Paris. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Water floods a few low roads on right bank of creek. At 20.0 feet, Water enter yards of homes downstream of water plant. Parts of the Garrard Park flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:15 PM EST Sunday the stage was 18.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight and continue falling to 13.9 feet early Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 18.5 feet on 02/13/2020. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Stay tuned to NOAA Weather Radio and your local media for the latest information. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lmk. The next statement will be issued Monday morning.
